name: romanesque
content:

relating to the style of building that was common in western and southern Europe from the 10th to the 12th centuries

the style of building that was common in western and southern Europe from the 10th to the 12th centuries: The twelfth-century church is one of the most outstanding examples of Italian Romanesque. My wife and I like great architecture and the Romanesque.
More examplesFewer examplesThe church is a lovely example of Catalan Romanesque.Over the five years that he remained in France he fell in love with the Romanesque.Only devout admirers of the Romanesque will want to drive to see the church.
